fr.hes.raynaudmonitoring.util

Class SystemUiHider

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.hes.raynaudmonitoring.util.SystemUiHider
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SystemUiHiderBase

    public abstract class SystemUiHider
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class that helps with showing and hiding system UI such as the status bar and navigation/system bar. This class uses backward-compatibility techniques described in Creating Backward-Compatible UIs to ensure that devices running any version of ndroid OS are supported. More specifically, there are separate implementations of this abstract class: for newer devices, getInstance(android.app.Activity, android.view.View, int) will return a instance, while on older devices getInstance(android.app.Activity, android.view.View, int) will return a SystemUiHiderBase instance.

    For more on system bars, see System Bars.

    See Also:
    View.setSystemUiVisibility(int), WindowManager.LayoutParams.FLAG_FULLSCREEN

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SystemUiHider.OnVisibilityChangeListener
      A callback interface used to listen for system UI visibility changes.

    • Field Detail

      • FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN_OLDER_DEVICES

        public static final int FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN_OLDER_DEVICES
        When this flag is set, the WindowManager.LayoutParams.FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN flag will be set on older devices, making the status bar "float" on top of the activity layout. This is most useful when there are no controls at the top of the activity layout.

        This flag isn't used on newer devices because the action bar, the most important structural element of an Android app, should be visible and not obscured by the system UI.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FLAG_FULLSCREEN

        public static final int FLAG_FULLSCREEN
        When this flag is set, show() and hide() will toggle the visibility of the status bar. If there is a navigation bar, show and hide will toggle low profile mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION

        public static final int FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION
        When this flag is set, show() and hide() will toggle the visibility of the navigation bar, if it's present on the device and the device allows hiding it. In cases where the navigation bar is present but cannot be hidden, show and hide will toggle low profile mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mActivity

        protected android.app.Activity mActivity
        The activity associated with this UI hider object.

      • mAnchorView

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SystemUiHider getInstance(android.app.Activity activity,
                                        android.view.View anchorView,
                                        int flags)
        Creates and returns an instance of SystemUiHider that is appropriate for this device. The object will be either a SystemUiHiderBase or SystemUiHiderHoneycomb depending on the device.
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity whose window's system UI should be controlled by this class.
        anchorView - The view on which View.setSystemUiVisibility(int) will be called.
        flags - Either 0 or any combination of FLAG_FULLSCREEN, FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION, and FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN_OLDER_DEVICES.

      • setup

        public abstract void setup()
        Sets up the system UI hider. Should be called from Activity.onCreate(android.os.Bundle).

      • isVisible

        public abstract boolean isVisible()
        Returns whether or not the system UI is visible.

      • hide

        public abstract void hide()
        Hide the system UI.

      • show

        public abstract void show()
        Show the system UI.

      • toggle

        public void toggle()
        Toggle the visibility of the system UI.

      • setOnVisibilityChangeListener

        public void setOnVisibilityChangeListener(SystemUiHider.OnVisibilityChangeListener listener)
        Registers a callback, to be triggered when the system UI visibility changes.
